XTB Hires Ex-Revolut Marketer as It Ramps Up Marketing Spend

‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏≠‡∏ò‡∏¥‡∏ö‡∏≤‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏ï‡∏∏‡∏ú‡∏•‡πÄ‡∏ö‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏´‡∏•‡∏±‡∏á‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏°‡∏°‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤‡∏ã‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏Ñ‡∏∞‡πÅ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡πÇ‡∏´‡∏ß‡∏ï‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏ú‡∏π‡πâ‡∏ä‡∏°‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ä‡∏∏‡∏°

EN

This article covers insights from the FMLS:25 summit, featuring an interview with Dor Eligula, Co-Founder and Chief Business Officer of BridgeWise. Eligula discusses the application of AI in investment research, noting the balance between automation and human judgment to prevent errors. He also identifies Asian markets as areas of "blue ocean" growth, influenced by local client behavior and demand. Additionally, the article includes a discussion with Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, following a debate on Prop Trading. Callan argues against the industry's current Prop Trading model, criticizing its heavy reliance on fees, loose risk controls, and the confusion it creates for retail audiences. He explains the reasons behind his stance which won the audience's vote during the summit.

Key Points

  • BridgeWise discusses the rollout of AI in investment research and Asian market growth
  • Dor Eligula emphasizes the combination of automation and human judgment in AI analytics
  • Brendan Callan of TRADU argues against the Prop Trading model citing fee dependency and risk issues

Article

We start with Dor‚Äôs reaction to the Summit and then move to broker growth and the quick wins brokers often overlook. Dor shares where he sees ‚Äúblue ocean‚Äù growth across Asian markets and how local client behaviour shapes demand. We also discuss the rollout of AI across investment research. Dor gives real examples of how automation and human judgment meet at Bridgewise ‚Äî including moments when analysts corrected AI output, and times when AI prevented an error. We close with a practical question: how retail investors can actually use AI without falling into common traps. Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Brendan Callan joined us fresh off the Summit‚Äôs most anticipated debate: ‚ÄúIs Prop Trading Good for the Industry?‚Äù Brendan argued against the motion ‚Äî and the audience voted him the winner. In this interview, Brendan explains the reasoning behind his position. He walks through the message he believes many firms avoid: that the current prop trading model is too dependent on fees, too loose on risk, and too confusing for retail audiences. We discuss why he thinks the model grew fast, why it may run into walls, and what he believes is needed for a cleaner, more responsible version of prop trading. This is Brendan at his frankest ‚Äî sharp, grounded, and very clear about what changes are overdue. broker operating since 2016, offering access to multiple trading platforms, over 1,000 instruments, and flexible account types for different trading styles. We break down Blueberry‚Äôs regulatory structure, including its Australian Financial Services License (AFSL), as well as its authorisation and registrations in other jurisdictions. The review also covers supported platforms such as MetaTrader 4, MetaTrader 5, cTrader, TradingView, Blueberry.X, and web-based trading. You‚Äôll learn about available instruments across forex, commodities, indices, share CFDs, and crypto CFDs, along with leverage options, minimum and maximum trade sizes, and how Blueberry structures its Standard and Raw accounts. We also explain spreads, commissions, swap rates, swap-free account availability, funding and withdrawal methods, processing times, and what traders can expect from customer support and additional services.
